text: James O'Neill (May 4, 1810 - March 28, 1882) was a Wisconsin settler, jurist, and sawmill owner.Clark County, Wisconsin History-James O'Neill He was born in Lisbon, New York and worked in lumber in Canada and New York. He also worked on riverboats on the Mississippi River.James O'Neill, Wisconsin Historical Society The community of Neillsville was named in his honor, as was O'Neill Creek, which runs through the center of the city and drains into the Black River. He arrived in the area around 1845, looking for a location to build a sawmill along the Black River.MacBridge, R. J. "The History of Clark County ", Thorp Courier, 1909-06-17. In 1854, O’Neill’s Mill, (as Neillsville was originally called), was selected as the county seat of Clark County.MacBridge, R. J. "The History of Clark County ", Thorp Courier, 1909-06-17. O'Neill served as treasurer of Clark County in 1861-1865 and on the Clark County Board of Supervisors serving as chairman. He served in the Wisconsin State Assembly in 1849 and 1868. He owned a lumber business and hotel in Neillsville until his death.History of Clark County, Wisconsin-James O'Neill His nephew was James O'Neill who was a judge and served in the Wisconsin State Assembly.James O'Neill (judge)-History of Ckark County, Wisconsin He died on March 28, 1882, and is buried in Neillsville City Cemetery.[https://www.marshfieldnewsherald.com/story/news/local/community/2014/06/25/from- the-second-story-wisconsins-poet-laureate-visits-neillsville/11305387/ Marshfield News Herald ==See also== *History of Wisconsin ==Notes== Category:People from Lisbon, New York Category:People from Neillsville, Wisconsin Category:Businesspeople from Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:County supervisors in Wisconsin Category:County officials in Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state court judges Category:History of Wisconsin Category:1810 births Category:1882 deaths Category:19th-century American politicians
title: James O'Neill (Wisconsin settler)
